text: Hasan Ali Khan Garroosy (1820–1900), also known as Amīr(-e) Neẓām Garrūsī, was an Iranian diplomat, officer, statesman, and literary figure of the Qajar period. He was born in Bijar to a family of Kurdish Kabudvand chiefs in 1820. Ḥasan Ali's unusually broad education included Arabic and Persian composition, history, calligraphy, and perhaps some theology. Ḥasan Ali served sixty-four years under three monarchs of the Qajar Dynasty. He died on 5 Ramadan, January 1900. He was buried in the shrine of Shah Nimatullah Wali in Mahan, Iran. ==See also== *Amir Nezam House ==References== Category:Iranian diplomats Category:1820 births Category:1900 deaths
